title: Does the United States own the land in France where American soldiers are buried? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m afraid I don’t have an answer but thought I’d share a page I found listing all the American cemeteries in France.: American Cemeteries in France - ABMC | U.S. Embassy & Consulates in France As a Canadian, I know that France granted the land that our Vimy Ridge Memorial stands on to Canada in perpetuity. I believe the reason had to do with how difficult the battle was and the fact that so many Canadians died to finally capture the Ridge. I would therefore look for any important battles fought by primarily American forces in France and check if the land containing any memorial in that regard was granted to the U.S. as a result. That’d be the starting point for research if it was me. Good luck in your research! P.S. Just to clarify, the land is granted in perpetuity but that doesn’t mean it transfers ownership. It is merely giving the land over for a certain agreed upon use.

Yes, the sites of overseas battlefield cemeteries (not just in France) have been granted to the United States by the host country in perpetuity. https://www.abmc.gov/sites/default/files/publications/EN_997_020_ABMC-Commemorative-Sites-Booklet-MAR2018_508.pdf
